H0.text: Friction is the force that opposes motion between two surfaces that are touching.

H1.text: Tension is the force that opposes motion between two surfaces that are touching.

H2.text: Vibration is the force that opposes motion between two surfaces that are touching.

H3.text: Gravity is the force that opposes motion between two surfaces that are touching.

A4.text: Dry friction is a force that opposes the relative lateral motion of two solid surfaces in contact.

A5.text: Static friction is friction between two or more solid objects that are not moving relative to each other. For example, static friction can prevent an object from sliding down a sloped surface.
